div.title: Mapping COBIT 5 process reference model into OSCAL
div.p: See COBIT 5, Enabling Business Processes p. 25 for a description of the process reference model.

stmt.p: COBIT 5 distinguishes groups of controls in five different domains.
Combines the inherited domain code with a sequential two-digit number (padded zeros) e.g. EDM01 for the first control in domain EDM (Evaluate, Direct and Monitor).
A normative description of the control (process).
The fact that this is an IT-related goal (as opposed to any other type) is captured by including a property prop with @class='scope' with the value IT.

The control enhancement used to describe this is the same as is used for (rows in) the next table, the process-related goal table. Note however that the IT-related goals (as indicated by the scope property) are implicit cross-links to elsewhere in COBIT 5.

control.prop: Governance or Management Practice RACI assignments

stmt.p: In COBIT 5, the RACI index is presented at the level of the process (control). Mapped to OSCAL, this table's rows are allocated instead to the appropriate control enhancement (practice) to which they belong.

The RACI index enhancement presents a simple list of properties, each one naming a party designated for RACI indexing. The properties must have @class values of responsible, accountable, consulted or informed (exclusively of one another). More than one property is expected to have any of these although guidelines suggest there should be only a single party marked as accountable.
RACI tables for controls and across control sets and families can be constructed from these values.

Note that according to COBIT (p. 26) not all practice inputs are represented explicitly, but only those that are specific to particular practices. So if a practice has an input due to another practice having all or all EDM as an output (for example), such an input is not listed. Only inputs designated for this particular control (practice) are indicated.
Assuming we know which output settings are regarded as wildcards in this way, implicit inputs can be detected by query.
